definition: to look forward eagerly to sth/keenly desired
definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
to cut/to slice/tangent (math)
to hope for/to long for/to expect

sentences.english: I really hope this card arrives in time for Valentine's Day.
sentences.chinese: 我切盼這張卡片能在情人節當天準時寄達。

sentences.english: We await your further news with interest.
sentences.chinese: 我們切盼你方進一步的消息。

sentences.english: The attorney craved the court's indulgence.
sentences.chinese: 律師切盼法庭的寬大處理。

sentences.english: He wants to be the one in whom " we live and move and have our being."
sentences.chinese: 他切盼“我們生活，動作，存留，都在乎他。”

definition: to eagerly anticipate

earnest/ardent (hope etc)
to hope for/to long for/to expect
to raise one's head and look
to hope/to wish/hope/wish/(old) name of an official post
to remember one's parents/to feel homesick for one's relatives
to yearn for/to miss
to raise one's head and look into the distance/fig. to forward to/to long for
to look forward eagerly/to long for
please answer (epistolary style)
wholeheartedly/sincerely
one's hometown
